problem.p: Which of the following are the core dimensions of the Data Model in DHIS 2 (Select one or more)?

div.p: As highlighted in the core concepts presentation, there are 3 core dimensions in DHIS2.
Organization units refers to the geographical location or where aspect Data Elements refers to what we are collecting Periods refers to when we are collecting that information

choicegroup.choice: The geographical location of the data

div.p: In the core concepts presentation, organization units are referred to as the geographical location of the data

problem.p: In DHIS2, data elements and indicators represent the same concept.

div.p: In the building blocks presentation, it is noted that data elements and indicators represent different concepts. Data elements are the raw data, while indicators are calculated values.

problem.p: Which of the following are data elements (select one or more)?

div.p: The data elements are the raw data values that we collect. Calculated values such as ratios and incidences are considered indicators.
